abstract: Civic leaders and environmental experts welcome OneNYC, ambitious long-term environmental plan for New York City introduced by Mayor Bill de Blasio, but caution that it remains unclear how measures will be achieved; far-reaching goals include eliminating use of landfills by 2030 and lifting some 800,000 people from poverty.
lead_paragraph: As Mayor Bill de Blasio called on New Yorkers to send no waste to landfills by 2030, and aimed to lift 800,000 people from poverty or near-poverty in a decade, attention quickly turned to a follow-up question: How?

headline.main: New York City’s Environmental Goals Draw Praise, and Questions on How to Fulfill Them
headline.print_headline: City Environmental Goals Draw Praise, and Questions on How to Fulfill Them

snippet: As Mayor Bill de Blasio called on New Yorkers to send no waste to landfills by 2030, and aimed to lift 800,000 people from poverty or near-poverty in a decade, attention quickly turned to a follow-up question: How?
